contentrichtext.text: <!-- This article was auto-generated by [[User:Polbot]]. --> {{Taxobox | name = Xingu River ray | image = White-blotched River Stingray Potamotrygon leopoldi 2284px.jpg | status = DD | status_system = IUCN2.3 | regnum = [[Animalia]] | phylum = [[Chordata]] | classis = [[Chondrichthyes]] | ordo = [[Myliobatiformes]] | familia = [[Potamotrygonidae]] | genus = ''[[Potamotrygon]]'' | species = '''''P. leopoldi''''' | binomial = ''Potamotrygon leopoldi'' | binomial_authority = [[Mariano N. Castex|Castex]] & [[Hugo P. Castello|Castello]], 1970 | synonyms = }} The '''Xingu River ray''' or '''white-blotched river stingray''', '''''Potamotrygon leopoldi''''', is a species of [[fish]] in the [[Potamotrygonidae]] family. It is [[Endemism|endemic]] to [[Brazil]] and takes its name from the [[Xingu River]]. Its natural [[habitat]] is [[river]]s. It is threatened by [[habitat loss]]. [[File:Potamotrygon leopoldi.jpg|thumb|left|A group photographed in the [[Dallas World Aquarium]]]] [[File:Potamotrygon leopoldi.ogg|240px|left|thumb|''[[Potamotrygon leopoldi]]'']] {{Commons|Potamotrygon leopoldi}} ==Source== * Rosa, R.S. & AraÃºjo, M.L.G. 2000. [http://www.iucnredlist.org/search/details.php/39403/all Potamotrygon leopoldi]. [http://www.iucnredlist.org 2006 IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. ] Downloaded on 3 August 2007. {{Rajiformes-stub}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Xingu River Ray}} [[Category:Fish of Brazil]] [[Category:Potamotrygon]] [[Category:Endemic fauna of Brazil]]
